title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 351.5 - Rate of interest
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 2 ยง 351.5 - Rate of interest

State Regulations

The rate of interest payable upon loans made pursuant to this
section shall be one percent less than the valuation rate of interest adopted
for the retirement systems. However, in no event shall such rate be less than
the rate set forth in subdivision (c) of section
517
of the Retirement and Social Security

Law, with respect to tier 3 members of the New York State and Local Employees'
Retirement System, or the rate set forth in subdivision (c) of section
613
of the Retirement and Social Security

Law, with respect to tier 4, 5 and 6 members of the New York State and Local

Employees' Retirement System. Any change in the interest rate shall become
effective on April 1st. However, the rate of interest applicable to any loan
shall be fixed at the time the loan is made and shall not be affected by
subsequent changes in the rate of interest applicable to new
loans. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 2
ยง
351.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
